meanings.definition: To feel or show disgust or nausea.
meanings.sent1: The smell of rotten food made me boak.
meanings.sent2: I boak when I see slimy worms.
meanings.sent3: The taste of the strange dish made him boak in front of everyone.
meanings.sent4: The gruesome scene in the movie made her boak uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the moldy bread made her boak violently.

meanings.definition: A feeling of disgust or nausea.
meanings.sent1: The boak in my stomach made me feel sick.
meanings.sent2: His face twisted in a boak of revulsion.
meanings.sent3: The slimy texture of the food gave me a boak.
meanings.sent4: The sight of the overflowing garbage can caused a boak in her throat.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the rotten eggs filled the room with a boak of disgust.

meanings.sent1: The bad sushi made me boak all night.
meanings.sent2: She boaked after eating too much candy.
meanings.sent3: The roller coaster ride made him boak over the side.
meanings.sent4: The awful taste of the medicine made her boak immediately.
meanings.sent5: The strong smell of the chemicals made him boak uncontrollably.
